results.title: A Frog's life
results.brief_description: After collecting frog spawn from a river and putting it into a tank, young children observe the hatching of the spawn and the development of the tadpoles into frogs. Close-up photography is used in recording the gradual change in the frog’s development.

results.title: A Friendly game
results.brief_description: A study and interpretation of the racist and capitalist philosophies. Two men, one white and one black, engage in a chess game, the stakes being $100 if the white man wins and the white man’s expensive chess set if he loses. At first the white man thinks the whole bet is silly since he appears to be winning. But, as the tables turn he becomes more and more upset until he loses and is unwilling to give up his chess set.

results.title: A Friend at the door
results.creator_credit: James Beveridge, ONF | NFB and Leslie McFarlane
results.brief_description: This is a story of how rural social workers in British Columbia cover a large and rugged province, and of the ways in which they help people in many kinds of trouble to solve their problems. Taking four cases - a pensioner, a youngster in juvenile court, an unmarried mother and a family distressed by the threat of illness and poverty - the film describes how each case is investigated, and how people in need are put in touch with available aid, both government and private.

results.title: A Fresh view: impressionism and post impressionism
results.creator_credit: Melissa Llewelyn-Davies and Educational Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Art of the western world”.
An episode in the comprehensive art history series, “Art of the Western World”, that focuses on art work from the impressionists to the Post-Impressionists. Narrated by Michael Wood, this program focuses on the works of such artists as Gustave Courbet, Georges Seurat, Vincent Van Gogh and Paul Cezanne, presenting the rejection of academic techniques that impressionism represented and its celebration of colour and light to the progression of these themes in the works of Post-Impressionism. Through a discussion of the works in their historical, religious, intellectual and social context, this program provides both a thorough outline of these periods in art history and underlines their relevance to issues outside the parameters of the works themselves.

results.title: A Freighter in port
results.brief_description: A study of an ocean-going cargo vessel in port, showing how the cargo is loaded and stowed by the wharf labourers (longshoremen), and how the crew makes the ship ready for sea.

results.title: A Fortunate life
results.brief_description: A Fortunate Life, the remarkable story of Bert Facey, an ordinary Australian whose extraordinary life spans some of the most significant historical milestones along Australia’s path to nationhood. Adapted from the best selling novel, “A Fortunate Life”, Facey’s experiences constitute a moving saga from his harsh early days as a child on the goldfields of Kalgoorlie, through his adolescence as a bushman in rugged North-West Australia, to the savage bloody carnage on the beaches of Gallipoli. Through it all Bert Facey remains optimistic and totally without cynicism. “A Fortunate Life” is an inspirational tale of one man’s struggle against seemingly overwhelming barriers to achieve peace and contentment. Rated: PG

results.title: A Foreign language
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Tom Daly, Wolf Koenig, Roman Kroitor and Stanley Jackson
results.brief_description: This film observes, in a Montreal public school, the teaching of English to immigrant children. To thousands of children arriving in Canada from Greece, Italy, France, Germany or Japan, English is “a foreign language.” Under able coaching they begin to understand and even enjoy the vagaries of the English language.
